column8: Computationally friendly name of the evidence variable
Computationally friendly name of the evidence variable
The description of the evidence variable
The description of the evidence variable

active | administratively-completed | approved | closed-to-accrual | closed-to-accrual-and-intervention | completed | disapproved | in-review | temporarily-closed-to-accrual | temporarily-closed-to-accrual-and-intervention | withdrawn
Organization that initiates and is legally responsible for the study
Defined path through the study for a subject
Used to search for the study
Used to search for the study

An "analysis" is a table of the results (p-values, betas) of the genome wide association analysis (GWAS) between genomic variations and phenotype. Typical analyses have millions of p-values across the genome.
Study collection instruments (questionnaires) or protocols describing the data collection, cleaning or analysis.
Matrices of positions on the genome, and samples from subjects, where the cells are the genotype (A/A, A/B, B/B) for a variation for that sample. Typically PLINK, .VCF or .MAF format.

Tables of demographic, clinical or exposure variables in which the rows are study participants (subjects), the columns are variables, and the cells are the value measured for that subject for that variable.
Biological samples taken from the study participants (subjects). There can be more than one sample taken from each subject.
The number of study participants in the study.
Subset of the study that is distinguished from others by separate (funding or research) focus from other arms of the study. Access control in dbGaP is at the parent study level.
A variable is demographic, clinical or exposure measurement of a study subject or sample from a subject (e.g., height, weight, blood pressure, etc).
n-a | early-phase-1 | phase-1 | phase-1-phase-2 | phase-2 | phase-2-phase-3 | phase-3 | phase-4
treatment | prevention | diagnostic | supportive-care | screening | health-services-research | basic-science | device-feasibility
Researcher who oversees multiple aspects of the study
Facility where study activities are conducted
